summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, scheduling hearings on two defense motions: one under Federal Rule of Evidence 412 (regarding victim evidence) and one under Federal Rule of Evidence 702/Daubert (regarding expert testimony). The order requires the parties to coordinate and propose dates for back-to-back hearings.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, subject to the court's order regarding evidentiary motions.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge issuing the order, scheduling hearings on defense motions related to evidence rules.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Tentative Rule 412 Hearing Date
events.description: Court previously set a tentative date for the hearing on the defense motion under Federal Rule of Evidence 412.

events.title: Court Order Issued
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an order scheduling combined hearings for defense motions under Rules 412 and 702/Daubert.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: The defense filed two key evidentiary motions: one under Federal Rule of Evidence 412 (regarding victim evidence) and one under Federal Rule of Evidence 702/Daubert (regarding expert testimony).
Judge Nathan ordered that the hearings for these motions be conducted back-to-back due to significant overlap in substance.
The court is required to conduct an in camera hearing for the Rule 412 motion, giving the victim and parties a right to attend.
The parties were directed to confer and jointly propose whether the hearings should be held on November 5, 9, or 10, 2021.
